public_info_summary: Swiss law mandates a 35% withholding tax (“anticipatory tax”) on dividends paid by Swiss companies, refundable if properly declared. Standard ex‑dividend and pay dates align with exchange and corporate practice; nominal mismatch breaks typically arise from internal processing errors rather than market standards.
reason: Nominal mismatch breaks are not standard market practice for Swiss dividends and likely reflect internal (NBIM) processing error.

raw:

- The ordinary dividend declared for ISIN CH0038863350 (Nestlé S.A.) in 2025 had ex‑date 22 April 2025 and gross amount CHF 3.05 per share ([globaltaxrecovery.com](https://globaltaxrecovery.com/nestle-sa/?utm_source=openai)).
- Swiss standard withholding tax on dividends is 35%, which is refundable upon proper declaration ([alpian.com](https://www.alpian.com/blog/investing/taxing-shares-in-switzerland?utm_source=openai)).

Because the ex‑date in question (25 April 2025) does not align with the reported official ex‑date (22 April 2025), and there's no public reference to a break or system error on that date, it's unclear whether this reflects a custodian internal discrepancy or a broader market practice. Thus, the likely source remains uncertain.

raw:
I was unable to find any public source referring to a "break" event for ISIN CH0038863350 (Nestlé SA) around 25.04.2025 labeled as a tax-related break ("Break type: TAX") with custodian CUST/UBSCH. However, the standard market-wide schedule for this ISIN shows:

• Ex-dividend date: 22.04.2025  
• Pay date: 24.04.2025  
• Dividend amount: CHF 3.05 per share ([divvydiary.com](https://divvydiary.com/en/nestle-stock-CH0038863350?utm_source=openai))

Swiss dividend taxation for Swiss-domiciled companies imposes a standard withholding tax of 35%, refundable to Swiss-resident shareholders who declare the income properly ([finpension.ch](https://finpension.ch/en/knowledge/dividend-tax-switzerland/?utm_source=openai)).

Because the actual ex-date and pay-date adhere to the public market schedule, and no deviation or internal error is evident in public sources, the observed "break" on 25.04.2025 is likely due to "external" standard market practice rather than an internal error.

    "issuer_country": "Switzerland",

    "reason": "Dates align with standard market schedule and typical Swiss withholding tax practice",
